quest.name: Mad, Bad, and Ebon-clad
journal: Dancing Wolf is ready to go on the offensive.

After noting that Tristan's attacks have ceased since increasing trade route patrols, Dancing Wolf puts forth his plan to lure the summoner into a trap. He has arranged for a lightly guarded caravan as bait, and would have you and Y'mhitra be present to assist in engaging the dangerous mage. Make your way to Camp Bluefog in northern Thanalan, and speak with the captain to learn the details of the ambush.

You arrive in Camp Bluefog, and Dancing Wolf explains his simple plan: the caravan, carrying a shipment of crystals, will conveniently break an axle on its way to the processing plant. You, Y'mhitra, and the captain are to take up positions nearby, and await Tristan's attack. Head to your assigned position, and stay alert for the black-robed madman.

Lured by the promise of easy plunder, a mage and his flame-enshrouded familiar have appeared and assaulted the caravan. Defeat the ebon-clad summoner and Ifrit-Egi, and put an end to the string of callous attacks.
Following a furious exchange of arcane violence, the black-robed villain lies defeated at your feet. Tend now to the wounded courier decoy.

Dancing Wolf and Y'mhitra join you at the scene of the battle, after defeating opponents of their own. Upon inspecting the body of the summoner, however, the flame captain is astonished to discover that the assailant is not Tristan, but Tristan's elder brother, Kahedin. It is then that the Ascian of the Twelfth Chalice appears, lamenting his decision to employ the siblings as pawns. The Paragon proceeds to laud the primal-slaying efforts of the Bringer of Light, before vanishing as abruptly as he had appeared. Return now to the Hall of Flames in Ul'dah, and discuss these revelations with Dancing Wolf.

The identity of the black-robed menace has finally been revealed as the long-dead Kahedin─a reanimated puppet of a powerful Ascian. Though Tristan and his brother are now free of the Paragon's manipulations, Dancing Wolf is intent on exacting vengeance on the callous immortal. Y'mhitra counsels caution, warning that the servants of Darkness are not to be lightly challenged. To that end, the researcher then instructs you in yet another secret of ancient Allagan magicks. Continue your efforts to master the art of summoning that you might benefit from the wisdom hidden within the remaining tomestones.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Dancing Wolf upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Dancing Wolf at Camp Bluefog.
Lie in wait at the designated location.
Defeat the ebon-clad summoner and Ifrit-Egi.
Speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. I hope you are prepared to take action.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Ever since we increased our presence on the trade routes, our black-robed villain has ceased his attacks. Now it is our turn to go on the offensive.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: With the blessings of my superiors, I have arranged for a lightly guarded shipment of crystals with which we will lure Tristan into an ambush.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And I want you there when we spring the trap! I have already sent word to Y'mhitra, and she will meet us in Camp Bluefog. Let us bring an end to this, Forename.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Have you spoken with Captain Wolf? I suggest we follow his orders, and trust in the preparations of the Immortal Flames.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We have been waiting for you, Forename. Let us put Captain Wolf's plan into action!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Forename, you're here. Good. Our “crystal couriers” have just left camp.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: The plan is simple: the caravan will head towards the processing plant, but conveniently break an axle before reaching the east watchtower.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: We three will take up separate positions nearby, and wait for Tristan to take the bait─I've had the driver complaining long and loudly about the lack of a suitable escort for his precious cargo, so we can be reasonably sure that an attack will come.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I trust you need no further explanations? Head to your assigned position, and do your best to keep out of sight.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Is aught amiss? This tree is hardly big enough to conceal the both of us...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: If I've read him aright, Tristan will be unable to resist this lure. But enough talk─take up your position, and keep an eye out for black-robed madmen.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER02103
dialogue.text: ...You're here for the ambush? Uh, it's a pleasure to meet you and all, but you'd best keep your distance─we wouldn't want the enemy avoiding our carefully laid trap, eh?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER02103
dialogue.text: Aaargh! It burns! IT BURNS!!!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Talk to me, soldier!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER02103
dialogue.text: I... I'll live, Captain. He popped right out of thin air... Took me by surprise...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The same happened to me. Another man in dark robes stepped through some manner of portal, and assailed me with spells.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: My position also came under attack─an underling, judging by the ease with which I dispatched him. But I have never before seen such teleportation magicks...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...No! It cannot be...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You know this man, Captain Wolf?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: This is Kahedin─Tristan's brother! But how...? He was tempered...slain...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: (-Haughty Voice-)...And now both siblings have disappointed me. <sigh> I should exercise more care in choosing my pawns.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: An Ascian!? That voice... You were the one who taught Tristan the art of summoning! Have you come to inflict yet more misery upon the world!?

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: ...Tristan? Yes, that was the other's name. I had hoped to groom him─granted him the knowledge of Allag's mages that he might unleash his wrath against the primals. Alas, he was all too easily vanquished...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: No matter. The Bringer of Light has proven a more-than-adequate replacement for my failed god-slayer.

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: With every primal you kill, the beastmen's fervor grows ever hotter. We need but supply the tribes with crystals...and watch as they summon ever more terrible deities!

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: When the confluence of chaos reaches its peak, the world shall be swallowed in Darkness. Our master shall rise again...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...He's gone.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And we should be gone as well. I shall see that my soldier is treated for his wounds, then await you outside the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Once again, a Paragon lurks behind the curtain, pulling the strings. I should have suspected...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...I believe some reassessment is in order. We now know that the black-robed menace we thought to be Tristan was actually his brother, Kahedin─a reanimated puppet, under the control of an Ascian.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Both brothers were present at Ifrit's defeat, so Kahedin's aura, too, would have been stained with the primal's essence. Which, if I understand correctly, would explain his ability to command the egi.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: But for that Ascian to raise the lad's corpse and press him into service as his pet summoner... I shall see the blackguard suffer for his cruel depravity!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, the Paragon has many crimes for which he must answer. But we must move with great caution─the power of these immortals is not to be underestimated.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I will return to Gridania, and redouble my efforts to decipher the remaining tomestones. We cannot face an Ascian unprepared!

obj.n: I Could Have Tranced All Night
